result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam J Demeyers

records.addlTxt:
8:31 AM Defendant Adam J Demeyers appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski in court for Adam J Demeyers.  Attorney Azucena C Guizar Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a plea and sentencing hearing. 
Defense has not had an opportunity to discuss the offer with the Defendant. Defendant indicates he in not willing to accept the offer or plea. 
State puts the offer on the record. 
Defense request jury trial and status. 
BTC: Matter set for trial and status.
Jury trial scheduled for March 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for March 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.

8:35 AM Defendant Adam J Demeyers not in court.  Attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski in court for Adam J Demeyers.  Attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defendant does not appear. 
Defense indicates that the defendant has had his parole revoked and is spending time in the WPS. Makes statements on the record. 
BTC: Matter set over for COP.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:50 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Donald A Montgomery not in court. Attorney Joe Kremkoski not in court for Defendant Donald A Montgomery. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defendant does not appear
State is requesting a bench warrant and bond forfeiture. 
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited.

Back on the record at 9:31am. Attorney Joe Kremkoski now in court. 
Defense provides explanation for client's non-appearance and puts statements on the record. 
State does not object. 
BTC: Vacate warrant and reinstate bond. Matter set over for a status.
Pre-Trial Conference and Order/case adjourned off the record.
Status conference on July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:45 PM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Adam J Demeyers appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Grant Ian Henderson for Adam J Demeyers appeared by video. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on March 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
